sen.j: 川上 音二郎（かわかみ おとじろう、1864年2月8日（文久4年1月1日_(旧暦)） - 1911年11月11日）は、「オッペケペー節」で一世を風靡した新派劇の俳優・芸人。
sen.e: Otojiro KAWAKAMI (February 8, 1864 – November 11, 1911) was an actor and an entertainer of Shinpa-Geki School (a New-School Play) who took the world by storm by his 'Oppekepe-bushi' (Oppekepe songs).
Otojiro KAWAKAMI (February 8, 1864 – November 11, 1911) was an actor and an entertainer of Shinpa-Geki (New-School Play) who took the world by storm by his 'Oppekepe-bushi' (Oppekepe songs).
sen.cmt: I don't think "School" or "a" are necessary.
sen.e: Otojiro KAWAKAMI (February 8, 1864 – November 11, 1911) was an actor and an entertainer of Shinpa-Geki (New-School Play) who took the world by storm by his 'Oppekepe-bushi' (Oppekepe songs).

sen.j: 幼名は川上 音吉（かわかみ おときち）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Otokichi KAWAKAMI.
His childhood name was Otokichi KAWAKAMI.
His childhood name was Otokichi KAWAKAMI.

sen.j: 1864年（文久4年） 筑前国博多中対馬小路町、現在の福岡市博多区対馬小路に生まれる。
sen.e: 1864: He was born at Nakatsumashojimachi, Hakata, Chikuzen Province (present Tsumashoji, Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City).
sen.cmt: 「中対馬小路町」の「町」の読み方が、machiなのかchoなのか不明です。ただし現在名「対馬小路」は「対馬小路 (ﾂﾏｼｮｳｼﾞ)」とありましたので、「中対馬小路町」はとりあえずNakatsumashojimachi としておきました。「http://yuusuke.info/40/M40132.htm#TU
sen.e: 1864: He was born in Nakatsumashojimachi, Hakata, Chikuzen Province (present-day Tsumashoji, Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City).
sen.cmt: Wording. I think "present-day" is more appropriate.
sen.e: 1864: He was born in Nakatsumashojimachi, Hakata, Chikuzen Province (present-day Tsumashoji, Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City).

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年） 継母と折り合いが悪く、家を飛び出し大阪へ密航。
sen.e: 1878: As he was on terrible terms with his stepmother, he ran away from home and smuggled himself to Osaka.
1878: As he was on terrible terms with his stepmother, he ran away from home and smuggled himself to Osaka.
1878: As he was on terrible terms with his stepmother, he ran away from home and smuggled himself to Osaka.

sen.j: 見つかるが出奔し東京都へ行く。
sen.e: Although he was found, he ran away again and went to Tokyo Metropolis.
Although he was found, he ran away again and went to Tokyo.
Although he was found, he ran away again and went to Tokyo.

sen.j: 福澤諭吉の書生など職を転々としながら、反政府の自由党_(日本)の壮士となり、政府から弾圧される。
sen.e: Frequently changing his jobs including a shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) of Yukichi FUKUZAWA, he became a political activist of the antigovernment Liberal Party (Japan) and was suppressed by the government.

Frequently changing jobs which included being a shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) of Yukichi FUKUZAWA, Kawakami became a political activist of the anti-government Liberal Party (Japan) which was suppressed by the government.
sen.cmt: Corrected it to sounds more natural.
sen.e: Frequently changing jobs which included being a shosei (a student who is given room and board in exchange for performing domestic duties) of Yukichi FUKUZAWA, Kawakami became a political activist of the anti-government Liberal Party (Japan) which was suppressed by the government.

sen.j: 1887年（明治20年） 自由民権運動の弾圧が激しさを増し、音二郎は東京から大阪に移り、自由童子と名乗り政府攻撃の演説、新聞発行などの運動を行ってしばしば検挙された。
sen.e: 1887: As the suppression on the Movement for Liberty and People's Rights became harder, Otojiro moved from Tokyo to Osaka and campaigned for anti-governmental speeches and publication of a newspaper, calling himself Jiyu Doji (Child for Liberty), only to be often arrested.

1887: As the suppression of the Movement for Liberty and People's Rights grew more severe, Otojiro moved from Tokyo to Osaka and campaigned for anti-governmental speeches, and became involved in publication of a newspaper, calling himself Jiyu Doji (Child for Liberty), only to be often arrested.

1887: As the suppression of the Movement for Liberty and People's Rights grew more severe, Otojiro moved from Tokyo to Osaka and campaigned for anti-governmental speeches, and became involved in publication of a newspaper, calling himself Jiyu Doji (Child for Liberty), only to be often arrested.

sen.j: こののち、落語家の桂文之助（後の二代目曽呂利新左衛門）に入門、浮世亭◯◯（うきよてい まるまる）と名乗る。
sen.e: After this he became a disciple of a Rakugo story teller, Bunnosuke KATSURA (later Shinzaemon SORORI, the second) and called himself Marumaru UKIYOTEI.
After this he became an apprentice of a Rakugo (comic) story teller Bunnosuke KATSURA (later Shinzaemon SORORI II) and called himself Marumaru UKIYOTEI.
sen.cmt: Instead of "the second", "II" is more appropriate. I also added "(comic)" after Rakugo to give a better understanding.
sen.e: After this he became an apprentice of a Rakugo (comic) story teller Bunnosuke KATSURA (later Shinzaemon SORORI II) and called himself Marumaru UKIYOTEI.

sen.j: 世情を風刺した『オッペケペー節』（桂藤兵衛上方3代目作）を寄席で歌い、大評判となる。
sen.e: He sang "Oppekepe-bush" (composed by Tobe KATSURA Kamigata, the third) satirizing the world at vaudeville theaters and gained a great reputation.
He sang "Oppekepe-bushi" (composed by Tobe Katsura KAMIGATA III) satirizing the world at vaudeville theaters and gained a great reputation.
sen.cmt: Spelling, corrected in accordance with instructions.
sen.e: He sang "Oppekepe-bushi" (composed by Tobe Katsura KAMIGATA III) satirizing the world at vaudeville theaters and gained a great reputation.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年） 書生芝居を堺市の卯の日座で旗揚げ。
sen.e: 1891: He launched his shoseishibai (dramas to propagate ideas on liberty and people's rights) at the Unohi-za Theater in Sakai City.
sen.cmt: 「コトバンク」によれば、「書生芝居」は別名「壮士芝居」と呼ばれ、「明治中期、自由党の壮士や青年知識階級の書生が、自由民権思想を広めるために始めた演劇」とありますので、'shoseishibai'として説明を加えました。http://kotobank.jp/word/壮士芝居
sen.e: 1891: He launched his shoseishibai (dramas to propagate ideas on liberty and people's rights) at the Unohi-za Theater in Sakai City.
1891: He launched his shoseishibai (dramas to propagate ideas on liberty and people's rights) at the Unohi-za Theater in Sakai City.

sen.j: 人気芸者の川上貞奴（本名：小山 貞）と結婚。
sen.e: He married a popular geisha (Japanese professional female entertainers at a drinking party) Sadayakko KAWAKAMI (her real name was Sada KOYAMA).
He married a popular geisha (Japanese professional female entertainers at drinking parties) Sadayakko KAWAKAMI (her real name was Sada KOYAMA).
He married a popular geisha (Japanese professional female entertainers at drinking parties) Sadayakko KAWAKAMI (her real name was Sada KOYAMA).

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年） 東京市神田 (千代田区)に川上座を開場。
sen.e: 1896: He opened the Kawakamiza Company in Kanda, Tokyo City (Chiyoda Ward).
1896: He opened the Kawakamiza in Kanda, Tokyo City (Chiyoda Ward).
1896: He opened the Kawakamiza in Kanda, Tokyo City (Chiyoda Ward).

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年） 3月と8月、衆議院議員総選挙衆議院議員総選挙の一覧に出馬、ともに落選。
sen.e: 1898: In March and August he ran for the general election of members of the House of Representatives and the list of the general election of members of the House of Representatives, but failed in both of them.
sen.cmt: 「衆議院議員総選挙衆議院議員総選挙の一覧に出馬」の日本語の意味がわかりにくいのですが、「「衆議院議員総選挙」と「衆議院議員総選挙の一覧」との両方に出馬した、という意味にとりました。「出馬する」はrun for electionの方が一般的と思われます。
sen.e: 1898: In March and August he ran for the general election of members of the House of Representatives and the list of the general election of members of the House of Representatives, but failed in both of them.

1898: In March and August he ran for the general election of members of the House of Representatives and the list of the general election of members of the House of Representatives, but failed in both of them.

sen.j: 資金繰りの為に川上座を手放し、妻・姪とともに下田市からいかだで当ても無く漂流し、結局は下田へ戻る。
sen.e: He relinquished the Kawakamiza for fund-raising and drifted on a raft with his wife and niece aimlessly, but after all returned to Shimoda.
He relinquished Kawakamiza for fund-raising and drifted on a raft with his wife and niece aimlessly, but ended up returning to Shimoda.
He relinquished Kawakamiza for fund-raising and drifted on a raft with his wife and niece aimlessly, but ended up returning to Shimoda.

sen.j: 1899年（明治32年） 渡米して現地で興行を行う。
sen.e: 1899: He went to the United States and gave performances there.
1899: He went to the United States and gave performances there.
1899: He went to the United States and gave performances there.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年） パリ万国博覧会 (1900年)で公演。
sen.e: 1900: He performed at the Paris World Exposition (1900).
1900: He performed at the Paris World Exposition (1900).
1900: He performed at the Paris World Exposition (1900).

sen.j: 米国興行に続いて人気を博する。
sen.e: He gained reputation followed by his performances in the United States.
He gained a reputation following his performances in the United States.
He gained a reputation following his performances in the United States.

sen.j: 同年帰国、「オッペケペー節」をレコードに録音（これが日本人初のレコードへの吹き込みといわれる）。
sen.e: He returned home in the same year and recorded Oppekepe-bushi (this is said to be the first recording by Japanese).
He returned home in the same year and recorded Oppekepe-bushi (this is said to be the first such recording by a Japanese).
He returned home in the same year and recorded Oppekepe-bushi (this is said to be the first such recording by a Japanese).

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）興行師として成功し、現在の大阪市中央区_(大阪市)北浜四丁目に洋風の劇場・帝国座を開場する。
sen.e: 1908: He succeeded as a promoter and opened the Teikoku-za Theater, a Western-style theater, at the present 4-chome, Kitahama, Chuo Ward, Osaka City.
sen.cmt: 「大阪市中央区_(大阪市)北浜四丁目」の、「_(大阪市)」は省略しました。
sen.e: 1908: He succeeded as a promoter and opened the Teikoku-za Theater, a Western-style theater, at present-day 4-chome, Kitahama, Chuo Ward, Osaka City.
1908: He succeeded as a promoter and opened the Teikoku-za Theater, a Western-style theater, at present-day 4-chome, Kitahama, Chuo Ward, Osaka City.

sen.j: 同時に帝国女優養成所を創設。
sen.e: At the same time he founded the Empire Training School for Actresses.
At the same time he founded the Empire Training School for Actresses.
At the same time he founded the Empire Training School for Actresses.

sen.j: 1911年（明治44年）舞台で倒れ死去。
sen.e: 1911: He fell down on the stage and died.
1911: He fell down on the stage and died.
1911: He fell down on the stage and died.

tit.cmt: I think apprentice is more appropriate.

sen.j: 川上秋月音二郎と同じ元新派の俳優で、川上元次郎と名乗った。
sen.e: Shugetsu KAWAKAMI: a former actor of Shinpa, like Otojiro, and called himself Motojiro KAWAKAMI.
Shugetsu KAWAKAMI was a former actor of Shinpa, like Otojiro, who called himself Motojiro KAWAKAMI.
Shugetsu KAWAKAMI was a former actor of Shinpa, like Otojiro, who called himself Motojiro KAWAKAMI.

sen.j: 後に寄席に出て「新講話」と名付けた、客から借りた品物をお題にした噺をつとめることを生業にした。
sen.e: He later performed at vaudeville theaters and earned his livelihood by telling stories, which he called 'Shin Kowa' (new storytelling), about some stuff borrowed from audiences.
He later performed at vaudeville theaters and earned his livelihood by telling stories, which he called 'Shin Kowa' (new storytelling), about things borrowed from audience members.
He later performed at vaudeville theaters and earned his livelihood by telling stories, which he called 'Shin Kowa' (new storytelling), about things borrowed from audience members.

sen.j: 1985年、日本放送協会の大河ドラマで妻の川上貞奴を描いた『春の波濤』が放送された。
sen.e: 1985: "Spring Waves" which drew his wife Sadayakko KAWAKAMI was broadcast in Taiga dorama (NHK historical dramas) from the Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK).
1985: "Spring Waves" which depicted his wife Sadayakko KAWAKAMI was broadcast in Taiga dramas (NHK historical dramas) of the Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK).
1985: "Spring Waves" which depicted his wife Sadayakko KAWAKAMI was broadcast in Taiga dramas (NHK historical dramas) of the Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK).

sen.j: 貞奴は松坂慶子、音二郎は中村雅俊が務めた。
sen.e: Sadayakko was acted by Keiko MATSUZAKA and Otojiro by Masatoshi NAKAMURA.
Sadayakko was acted by Keiko MATSUZAKA and Otojiro by Masatoshi NAKAMURA.
Sadayakko was acted by Keiko MATSUZAKA and Otojiro by Masatoshi NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 1900年に川上一座が欧米興行を行った際に録音したオッペケペー節のレコードが発見され、97年に『甦るオッペケペー節』という題でCDがEMIミュージック・ジャパンから発売された。
sen.e: A phonograph record of Oppekepe-bushi which was recorded when the Kawakami troupe gave performances in Europe and the United States in 1900 was found, and a CD titled "Revived Oppekepe-bushi" was released from EMI Music Japan in 1997.

A phonograph record of Oppekepe-bushi which was recorded when the Kawakami troupe gave performances in Europe and the United States in 1900 was found, and a CD titled "Revived Oppekepe-bushi" was released by EMI Music Japan in 1997.

A phonograph record of Oppekepe-bushi which was recorded when the Kawakami troupe gave performances in Europe and the United States in 1900 was found, and a CD titled "Revived Oppekepe-bushi" was released by EMI Music Japan in 1997.

sen.j: ただし残念ながら音二郎と貞奴の肉声は録音されていなかった。
sen.e: Unfortunately, however, natural voices of Otojiro and Sadayakko had not been recorded.
Unfortunately, however, the natural voices of Otojiro and Sadayakko had not been recorded.
Unfortunately, however, the natural voices of Otojiro and Sadayakko had not been recorded.

sen.j: 福岡市博多区の川端通商店街北側入口近くにある福岡市地下鉄の中洲川端駅横には、音次郎の銅像あり、道を隔てて博多座と向きあっている。
sen.e: At the side of Nakasukawabata Station of Fukuoka City Subway near the northern entrance of the Kawabata Shopping Street of Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City, is a bronze statue of Otojiro, facing the Hakata-za Theater across the street.

At the side of Nakasukawabata Station of Fukuoka City Subway near the northern entrance of Kawabata Shopping Street in Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City, is a bronze statue of Otojiro, facing the Hakata-za Theater across the street.

At the side of Nakasukawabata Station of Fukuoka City Subway near the northern entrance of Kawabata Shopping Street in Hakata Ward, Fukuoka City, is a bronze statue of Otojiro, facing the Hakata-za Theater across the street.

sen.j: 2007年11月のシアタークリエのこけら落しでは、三谷幸喜作・演出の『恐れを知らぬ川上音二郎一座』が上演された。
sen.e: At the opening of the Theatre Creation in November, 2007, "Otojiro KAWAKAMI Troupe who doesn't know fear" written and staged by Koki MITANI was performed.
sen.cmt: 「シアタークリエ」は、そのホームページによりますと、英語名でTheatre Creationと書かれていますので、ここではそのままtheatreと、イギリス式に綴ります。http://www.tohostage.com/theatre_crea/
sen.e: At the opening of the Theatre Creation in November, 2007, "Otojiro KAWAKAMI Troupe who doesn't know fear", written and staged by Koki MITANI, was performed.
At the opening of the Theatre Creation in November, 2007, "Otojiro KAWAKAMI Troupe who doesn't know fear," written and staged by Koki MITANI, was performed.
sen.cmt: カンマ位置移動しました。

sen.j: 川上音二郎役はユースケ・サンタマリアが務めた。
sen.e: The role of Otojiro KAWAKAMI was played by Yusuke SANTAMARIA.
The role of Otojiro KAWAKAMI was played by Yusuke SANTAMARIA.
The role of Otojiro KAWAKAMI was played by Yusuke SANTAMARIA.
